title: EPISTOLA John H. Felts
html:
EPISTOLA John H. Felts

[Re: Jessy Randall's “Anything But Pregnant,” VERBATIM XXVII/2, Spring 2002] In The Dialogues of Alfred North Whitehead, the philosopher observed that illegitimate children born in rural England in the early to mid-nineteenth century were often called Mistykes. In the pre-WWII south, a banker's child might be referred to as "interest on a small deposit."

[John H. Felts, M.D. Winston-Salem, NC]
